trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Configuring Workday for Inbound Synchronization | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Configuring Workday for Inbound Synchronization | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Workday as source of identity data for Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Workday as source of identity data for Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Configuring Workday for Inbound Synchronization
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Configuring Workday for Inbound Synchronization

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show you the steps you need to perform in Workday and Azure AD to import people from Workday to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show you the steps you need to perform in Workday and Azure AD to import people from Workday to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure AD Premium subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure AD Premium subscription

trans-unit.source: A tenant in Workday
trans-unit.target: A tenant in Workday

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Workday
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Workday

trans-unit.source: Creating an integration system user
trans-unit.target: Creating an integration system user

trans-unit.source: Creating a security group
trans-unit.target: Creating a security group

trans-unit.source: Assigning the integration system user to the security group
trans-unit.target: Assigning the integration system user to the security group

trans-unit.source: Configuring security group options
trans-unit.target: Configuring security group options

trans-unit.source: Activating security policy changes
trans-unit.target: Activating security policy changes

trans-unit.source: Configuring user import in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Configuring user import in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Workday
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Workday

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Workday.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Workday.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Workday, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Workday, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Workday.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Workday.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Workday, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Workday, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Creating an integration system user
trans-unit.target: Creating an integration system user

trans-unit.source: In the Workday Workbench, enter create user in the search box, and then click Create Integration System User. Create user
trans-unit.target: In the Workday Workbench, enter create user in the search box, and then click Create Integration System User. Create user

trans-unit.source: Complete the Create Integration System User task by supplying a user name and password for a new Integration System User. Leave the Require New Password at Next Sign In option unchecked, because this user will be logging on programmatically.
trans-unit.target: Complete the Create Integration System User task by supplying a user name and password for a new Integration System User. Leave the Require New Password at Next Sign In option unchecked, because this user will be logging on programmatically.

trans-unit.source: Leave the Session Timeout Minutes with its default value of 0, which will prevent the user’s sessions from timing out prematurely. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Create Integration System User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Leave the Session Timeout Minutes with its default value of 0, which will prevent the user’s sessions from timing out prematurely. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Create Integration System User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Creating a security group
trans-unit.target: Creating a security group

trans-unit.source: For the scenario outlined in this tutorial, you need to create an unconstrained integration system security group and assign the user to it.
trans-unit.target: For the scenario outlined in this tutorial, you need to create an unconstrained integration system security group and assign the user to it.

trans-unit.source: Enter create security group in the search box, and then click Create Security Group. CreateSecurity Group
trans-unit.target: Enter create security group in the search box, and then click Create Security Group. CreateSecurity Group

trans-unit.source: Complete the Create Security Group task. Select Integration System Security Group—Unconstrained from the Type of Tenanted Security Group dropdown, to create a security group to which members will be explicitly added. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>CreateSecurity Group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Complete the Create Security Group task. Select Integration System Security Group—Unconstrained from the Type of Tenanted Security Group dropdown, to create a security group to which members will be explicitly added. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>CreateSecurity Group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Assigning the integration system user to the security group
trans-unit.target: Assigning the integration system user to the security group

trans-unit.source: Enter edit security group in the search box, and then click Edit Security Group. Edit Security Group
trans-unit.target: Enter edit security group in the search box, and then click Edit Security Group. Edit Security Group

trans-unit.source: Search for, and select the new integration security group by name. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Edit Security Group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Search for, and select the new integration security group by name. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Edit Security Group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Edit Security Group
trans-unit.target: Edit Security Group

trans-unit.source: Add the new integration system user to the new security group. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>System Security Group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Add the new integration system user to the new security group. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>System Security Group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring security group options
trans-unit.target: Configuring security group options

trans-unit.source: In this step, you grant to the new security group permissions for Get and Put operations on the objects secured by the following domain security policies:
trans-unit.target: In this step, you grant to the new security group permissions for Get and Put operations on the objects secured by the following domain security policies:

trans-unit.source: External Account Provisioning
trans-unit.target: External Account Provisioning

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Public Worker Reports
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Public Worker Reports

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: All Positions
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: All Positions

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Current Staffing Information
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Current Staffing Information

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Business Title on Worker Profile
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Business Title on Worker Profile

trans-unit.source: Enter domain security policies in the search box, and then click on the link, Domain Security Policies for Functional Area. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter domain security policies in the search box, and then click on the link, Domain Security Policies for Functional Area. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Search for system and select the System functional area. Click OK. Domain Security Policies
trans-unit.target: Search for system and select the System functional area. Click OK. Domain Security Policies

trans-unit.source: In the list of security policies for the System functional area, expand Security Administration and select the domain security policy, External Account Provisioning. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>
trans-unit.target: In the list of security policies for the System functional area, expand Security Administration and select the domain security policy, External Account Provisioning. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Edit Permissions, and then, on the Edit Permissionsdialog page, add the new security group to the list of security groups with Get and Put integration permissions. Edit Permission
trans-unit.target: Click Edit Permissions, and then, on the Edit Permissionsdialog page, add the new security group to the list of security groups with Get and Put integration permissions. Edit Permission

trans-unit.source: Repeat step 1, above, to return to the screen for selecting functional areas, and this time, search for staffing, select the Staffing functional area, and click OK. Domain Security Policies
trans-unit.target: Repeat step 1, above, to return to the screen for selecting functional areas, and this time, search for staffing, select the Staffing functional area, and click OK. Domain Security Policies

trans-unit.source: In the list of security policies for the Staffing functional area, expand Worker Data: Staffing, and repeat step 4 above for each of these remaining security policies:
trans-unit.target: In the list of security policies for the Staffing functional area, expand Worker Data: Staffing, and repeat step 4 above for each of these remaining security policies:

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Public Worker Reports
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Public Worker Reports

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: All Positions
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: All Positions

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Current Staffing Information
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Current Staffing Information

trans-unit.source: Worker Data: Business Title on Worker Profile
trans-unit.target: Worker Data: Business Title on Worker Profile

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Domain Security Policies</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Activating security policy changes
trans-unit.target: Activating security policy changes

trans-unit.source: Enter activate in the search box, and then click on the link,Activate Pending Security Policy Changes. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Activate</linkText>
trans-unit.target: Enter activate in the search box, and then click on the link,Activate Pending Security Policy Changes. <html></html><html></html> <linkText>Activate</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Begin the Activate Pending Security Policy Changes task by entering a comment for auditing purposes, and then click OK. Activate Pending Security
trans-unit.target: Begin the Activate Pending Security Policy Changes task by entering a comment for auditing purposes, and then click OK. Activate Pending Security

trans-unit.source: Complete the task on the next screen by checking the checkbox labelled Confirm, and then click OK. Activate Pending Security
trans-unit.target: Complete the task on the next screen by checking the checkbox labelled Confirm, and then click OK. Activate Pending Security

trans-unit.source: Configuring user import in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Configuring user import in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to configure Azure AD to import people from Workday.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to configure Azure AD to import people from Workday.

trans-unit.source: To configure user import in Azure AD, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user import in Azure AD, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: On the Workday application integration page, click Configure user import to open the Configure Provisioning dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Workday application integration page, click Configure user import to open the Configure Provisioning dialog.

trans-unit.source: On the Settings and admin credentials page, perform the following steps, and then click Next: Settings and admin credentials
trans-unit.target: On the Settings and admin credentials page, perform the following steps, and then click Next: Settings and admin credentials

trans-unit.source: In the Workday admin user name textbox, type the name of the user you have created in the Creating an integration system user section.
trans-unit.target: In the Workday admin user name textbox, type the name of the user you have created in the Creating an integration system user section.

trans-unit.source: In the Workday admin password textbox, type the password of the user you have created in the Creating an integration system user section.
trans-unit.target: In the Workday admin password textbox, type the password of the user you have created in the Creating an integration system user section.

trans-unit.source: In the Workday tenant URL textbox, type the URL or your Workday tenant.
trans-unit.target: In the Workday tenant URL textbox, type the URL or your Workday tenant.

trans-unit.source: On the Test connection page, click Start test to confirm connectivity, and then click Next. Test connection
trans-unit.target: On the Test connection page, click Start test to confirm connectivity, and then click Next. Test connection

trans-unit.source: On the Provisioning options page, click Next. Provisioning options
trans-unit.target: On the Provisioning options page, click Next. Provisioning options

trans-unit.source: On the Start provisioning dialog, click Complete. Start provisioning
trans-unit.target: On the Start provisioning dialog, click Complete. Start provisioning

trans-unit.source: You can now go to the Users section and check whether your Workday user has been imported.
trans-unit.target: You can now go to the Users section and check whether your Workday user has been imported.
